resources.string: José de Alencar Cable Car
Inaugurated as an initial part of Via Mangue to give access to Celso Furtado Avenue and Shopping Rio Mar.
Rua Paulo Guerra - Caxangá, Recife - PE, 50800-200
Museum of the City of Recife - Fort of the Five Points
It was built in February 1630 by command of the Dutch colonel Diederick van Waerdenburch and still in works successfully resisted an attack of the Portuguese forces in August 1630.
Praça das Cinco Pontas, s / n - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-500
Capibaribe River
Main river of the city, it crosses several districts until arriving at the sea, in the central region. Present in stories, songs, legends and poetry of Recife.
Shopping Riomar

RioMar Shopping is a large shopping center. Inaugurated on October 30, 2012, is the largest commercial enterprise in the Northeast of Brazil, being the 5th largest in the country and the 1st of its kind outside the state of São Paulo. It is the first high-luxury address of the North-Northeast, encompassing international designer stores. RioMar Shopping is the first shopping center in Brazil to win the AQUA (High Environmental Quality) seal.
Av. Republic of Lebanon, 251 - Pina, Recife - PE, 51110-160
Old Swing Bridge

From 1923, it was formed by three flights of iron, one being a vessels. It fell into disuse, was dismantled and replaced by concrete in 1971, called September 12. In 2003, it was renamed the Old Switched Bridge.
Pte. Giratoria, 161 - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-360
Mauritius Bridge of Nassau

Located where there was the first bridge of Latin America, built by Nassau in 1643. At its inauguration, in order to collect tolls, the episode of the "flying bull" occurred. It was rebuilt in 1917, in the government of Manoel Borba.
Pte. Maurício de Nassau, 308-524, Recife - PE
Ponte Buarque de Macedo

Originally built in wood (1882-1890), it connects Rio Branco Avenue to Praça da República. The bridge was inaugurated in 1890 as the name of Buarque de Macedo, minister who authorized the construction.
Pte. Buarque de Macedo, 115, Recife-PE, 50030-150
Emperor Wharf
The site of the arrival of Emperor Pedro II in the 19th century, today houses an amphitheater.
Av. Martins de Barros, 252 - Santana, Recife - PE, 50010-230
Forum Thomaz of Aquino
Inaugurated in 1938, it was a landmark of the center modernization and functioned as a hotel the year of 1992. It currently functions as a forum. In its place existed the Jesuit college of Recife.
Av. Martins de Barros, 593 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-230
Square 17

The name of the square honors and Pernambuco Revolution of 1817. In the center is the monument in honor of the aviators Gago Coutinho and Sacadura Cabral, also having image of Santos Dumont. There is still a fountain with marble India and the church of the Holy Spirit.
Praça Dezessete - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-070
Obelisk of Restoration

Designed by the Portuguese architect Maia Gomes based on a sketch by Francisco Brennand, also could not be left out of the tour. The monument was carved in Portugal, weighs 20 tons, is 10 meters high and was implanted above a rose of the winds. The work is dedicated to the heroes of the Pernambuco Insurrection and is currently located at Cais da Alfândega.
Church of Our Lady of the Livramento of the Pardos Men of Recife

At the end of the century. XVII, the brotherhood of the brown men built their chapel in Recife. The temple maintains the characteristics of its reformation that took place between the years of 1830 and 1856. The location of the church defined the formation of the streets Right and Penha, as well as the Patio, surrounded by mansions that house commercial establishments.
Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-340
Church of São Pedro dos Clérigos
Completed in 1782, The church is one of the most representative baroque temples in Brazil. The patio in its surroundings is well known for harboring several attractions related to the local culture.
Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-360
Church of the Divine Holy Spirit

Over the years, it had two denominations until being called as we know it today. Before 1654, it was the Calvinist Church of the French; after 1654, Church of Our Lady of the O; and from 1855, Church of the Divine Holy Spirit. The church is very well-known today for the peculiar shape of its main altar that reminds a bridal cake.
Praça Dezessete, S / N - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-000
Basilica of Our Lady of Carmo

Built on the site where once the palace of the good view of Maurice of Nassau existed, The Basilica and Convent of Nossa Senhora do Carmo is a Catholic architectural ensemble belonging to the first Carmelite Order. The basilica is well known for the strong presence of the baroque in its artistic and architectural composition.
Av. Dantas Barreto, 646 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50020-000
Church of Our Lady of the Rosary of the Black Men

Built between the years 1662 and 1667, in the reign of D Afonso VI, king of Portugal, of whom there is an oil portrait in the sacristy. In 1739 its façade was ruined and was recovered from 1777. At its doors are realized crowns of queens of the reefs maracatus.
R. Estreita do Rosário, s / n - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-130
Mother Church of the Blessed Sacrament of St. Anthony

Constructed between 1752 and 1790 in the place where there was an old gunpowder house of the Dutch. It maintains the original features of the main façade, with decorative elements modeled on reef sandstone.
Independence Square, s / n - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-080
Public Archive

With almost 285 years of existence, the building that currently houses the headquarters of the Archives Public in the Rua do Emperor Pedro Segundo, in the district of Santo Antônio, was already the House of Chamber and Chain of Recife, arriving to receive some political prisoners of important revolutions like Frei Caneca in 1825.
R. Emperor Pedro Segundo, 371 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-240
Franciscan convent

Built between 1606 and 1613. With the Dutch occupation had military use being transformed in the Ernesto Fortress (1630-16540) .In the 18th century it was adapted to the baroque style. The Franciscan Museum of Sacred Art.
R. Emperor Pedro Segundo, 206 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-050
Palace of justice

The Palace of Justice is a building of the city of Recife, capital of Pernambuco, Brazil. It was designed by Italian architect Giácomo Palumbo. It houses the Court of Justice of Pernambuco, and is located in Praça da República, Antônio Vaz Island, Santo Antônio neighborhood.
Praça da República, s / n - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-040
Palace of the Field of the Princesses

The Palácio das Campo das Princesas is the administrative headquarters of the state of Pernambuco, located in the city of Recife. Idealized since 1786 by the governor José César Meneses, was built in 1841 by the engineer Morais Âncora, under the command of the governor Francisco do Rego Barros, in the where was the Royal Treasury.
Praça da República, S / N - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-928
Brasília Teimosa

Neighborhood emerged from 1947, between the river and the sea, with strong fishing culture, being today a place of gastronomic diversity focused on the seafood and with access to the jetty where it is located the park of sculptures of Francisco Brennand.
Crystal Column

Being the main work in the complex of the park of the sculptures, the Crystal Column, with 32 meters of height is made in clay and bronze. To the total there are in the park 90 works (sculptures) of the sculptor and plastic artist from Pernambuco Francisco Brennand.
Recife - PE, 50030-230
Basilica of the Penha
Built in the seventeenth century and enlarged in 1882 in the Neorren-Renaissance style, is one of the largest and busiest Catholic temples in the city.
Dom Vital Square - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-280
Mother Church of São José
Mother Church of the District of San José, built in 1845, in neoclassical style, it has mosaic on the facade, work of Francisco Brennand.
São José, Recife - PE, 50010-120
Jose Estelita Wharf
One of the quays that form the landscape of Recife, is on the banks of the Pina River.
2443, Av. José Estelita, 1647 - São José, Recife - PE
Cabanga Yacht Club
Founded in 1942 in the Pina Basin for the practice of nautical sports.
s / n, Av. Eng. José Estelita - Cabanga, Recife - PE, 53427-660
Ponte do Pina (Ponte Agamenon Magalhães)
Inaugurated in the 1920s to connect the Pina to the Center of Recife, being reconstructed in 1953.
Pina Basin
Estuary of one of the main rivers that cut the city of Recife. Receive the waters of the rivers Jordan and Tejipió and it houses mangroves and riverside communities.
R. Bina do Pina - Nova Descoberta, Recife - PE
Colinas de Olinda
Colinas of the acropolis of Olinda, first capital of Pernambuco, Patrimony of humanity.
Digital Port
Central of operations of the Digital Port, technological park formed by local companies and multinationals in technology.
R. 210, Cais do Apolo, 222 - Recife, PE
Dome of the House of Culture
Old House of Detention of Recife. It functioned as a prison from 1850 to 1976, when was turned off and turned into a handicraft center.
R. Floriano Peixoto, 141 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50020-060
Hospital Pedro II
Inaugurated in 1861 in the district of the Rabbits, being a great reference until the first half of the 20th century. It has been restored and is part of the IMIP complex.
R. dos Coelhos, 300 - Boa Vista, Recife - PE, 50070-550
Hotel Central do Recife

Of eclectic characteristics, the Central Hotel was the first construction of the large size in Pernambuco. In its heyday the hotel received illustrious guests as the former President of the Republic Getúlio Vargas, the American filmmaker Orson Welles and the singer and actress Carmen Miranda.
Av. Manoel Borba, 209 - Boa Vista, Recife - PE, 50070-000
View Forum Posts
Rodolfo Aureliano Forum - Opened in 1999 to centralize TJPE services,makes references to classical architecture in its composition.
Av. Desembargador Guerra Barreto, s / n - Ilha Joana Bezerra, Recife - PE, 50080-900
Sport Stadium
Inaugurated in 1937, the Adelmar da Costa Carvalho Stadium is the Sport Clube do Recife.
Rua Sport Club do Recife - Retiro Island, Recife - PE, 50750-560
Reefs
Barrier of natural reefs existing in all the rim recifense, from which the name of the city.
Yacht Club Pernambuco
Sailing, yachting and water sports club, located in the Molhe of Recife.
Wall of Rocks of the Port of Recife, s / n - Brasília Teimosa, PE, 50030-230
Business JCPM

The modern JCPM Trade Center building, with its architectural design, promotes technical specifications, security systems and high technology, providing its occupants with differentiated comfort and low operating cost.
Av. Antônio de Goes, 60 - Pina, Recife - PE, 51010-000
Bairro do Pina

Pina is a neighborhood in the city of Recife and is north of Boa Viagem. It contains one of the two beaches of the capital of Pernambuco, Praia do Pina, also known as Praia do Sport, which is the continuation of Boa Viagem Beach.
Neighborhood of Boa Viagem

Boa Viagem is an extensive and populous noble neighborhood of the South Zone of Recife. One of its main features is its position along the Atlantic Ocean. The Boa Viagem avenue, which cuts the neighborhood completely, is by the sea.
Catamaran Club

Tourist club specialized in catamaran tours, with headquarters located near the strong of the five points, it also counts on complex that unites education, gastronomy, fun, culture, business and leisure,
s / n, Santa Rita Pier - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-360
N/A
Shopping Riomar Lookout
Terrace of Paço Alfândega
Catamaran Lookout
